title: Financial Expert Calls XRP a Generational Opportunity, But‚Ä¶
body: Prominent digital asset commentator Coach JV has reignited debate within the cryptocurrency community by asserting that XRP remains one of the most undervalued investment opportunities today. In a recent social media post, he warned that many investors may one day regret failing to recognize XRP‚Äôs long-term potential. Calls for Financial Reevaluation Coach JV encouraged his audience to reconsider how they allocate their financial resources, contrasting consumer spending with investment behavior. According to him, it is common for individuals to spend large sums, sometimes over $100,000, on luxury goods and lifestyle choices intended to signal status, while hesitating to place even a modest amount into emerging technologies or digital assets such as XRP. He argues that this disconnect is not a question of affordability, but one of priority. In his view, the reluctance to invest in potentially transformative assets stems from a lack of financial discipline or foresight rather than a lack of means. XRP will be the greatest missed opportunity of our lifetime. Men will drop $100,000 on a lifted truck to impress strangers‚Ä¶ But won‚Äôt invest $1,000 into an asset that could change their family‚Äôs future. America doesn‚Äôt have a money problem. We have a priority problem. ‚Äî Coach, JV (@Coachjv_) July 19, 2025 XRP‚Äôs Long-Term Potential Within his commentary, Coach JV emphasized that XRP still offers significant upside, even after recent price gains. At the time of his comments, XRP had climbed to over $3.50. Despite this, he and other supporters maintain that the token is still trading below its perceived value, particularly when measured against Bitcoin and other major cryptocurrencies. The argument among XRP advocates is that the token could play a central role in the future of cross-border payments and financial infrastructure, and that this utility could eventually be reflected in its market valuation. Coach JV also pointed to his earlier predictions as evidence of XRP‚Äôs growth. He recalled sharing similar views in 2020 when XRP was significantly cheaper. Since then, he noted, the token has multiplied in value, and he expects those who dismissed it at the time may now regret not taking action. Moving forward, he believes XRP could deliver further returns over the coming years. Mixed Views from the Crypto Community Reactions to Coach JV‚Äôs message have varied. Some crypto users, such as X commentator Schultzy, agreed with his underlying point about the lack of financial literacy. Schultzy highlighted that many people are never taught how to manage or grow wealth, either in school or at home, which leads to missed opportunities. We are on twitter, follow us to connect with us :- @TimesTabloid1 ‚Äî TimesTabloid (@TimesTabloid1) July 15, 2023 However, not everyone accepted the premise that XRP specifically would be the defining asset for wealth creation. Some respondents argued that while the message about investing wisely is valid, placing too much faith in a single cryptocurrency may be risky. He addressed the skepticism by reaffirming his stance. He maintains that history will favor those who invest in XRP now, suggesting that the long-term outlook will prove its value and silence critics by the end of the decade. Coach JV‚Äôs remarks reflect a broader conversation within the crypto investment space around risk, timing, and financial priorities. While XRP continues to spark debate, his statements underscore the importance of informed decision-making and strategic investment in emerging technologies. Whether or not XRP lives up to the expectations of its most vocal supporters, the discussion highlights the tension between short-term consumption and long-term wealth building. Disclaimer : This content is meant to inform and should not be considered financial advice. The views expressed in this article may include the author‚Äôs personal opinions and do not represent Times Tabloid‚Äôs opinion. Readers are urged to do in-depth research before making any investment decisions. Any action taken by the reader is strictly at their own risk. Times Tabloid is not responsible for any financial losses. title: Unveiling the Monumental US Japan Trade Deal: Trump‚Äôs Bold 15% Tariffs and $550B Investment
body: BitcoinWorld Unveiling the Monumental US Japan Trade Deal: Trump‚Äôs Bold 15% Tariffs and $550B Investment In the dynamic landscape of global economics, major announcements can send ripples across various sectors, including the ever-watchful cryptocurrency markets. A recent statement by former U.S. President Donald Trump regarding a significant US Japan trade deal has captured headlines, promising a new era of economic partnership and, controversially, reciprocal tariffs. What does this proposed agreement entail, and how might it reshape the economic ties between two of the world‚Äôs largest economies? Unpacking the Proposed US Japan Trade Deal: What Did Trump Announce? Former U.S. President Donald Trump recently took to his Truth Social platform to reveal what he described as a ‚Äúnew deal‚Äù with Japan. This announcement, delivered directly to his followers, outlined two primary components that could significantly alter the existing trade framework between the United States and Japan. Firstly, Trump stated that Japan would be subject to a 15% reciprocal tariff on goods it exports to the U.S. This implies a symmetrical application, where U.S. goods exported to Japan would also face a similar tariff, though the specifics were not fully detailed in his initial post. Such a move would mark a notable shift from current trade arrangements. Secondly, and perhaps even more striking, Trump claimed that this arrangement includes a staggering $550 billion in Japanese investment in the U.S. economy. This figure, if realized, would represent a massive influx of capital, potentially fueling job creation, infrastructure development, and technological advancements across various American sectors. The announcement, while concise, immediately sparked widespread discussion among economists, policymakers, and business leaders keen to understand the full implications of such a monumental agreement. The details surrounding the implementation and scope of both the tariffs and the investment remain subjects of intense scrutiny and anticipation. Reciprocal Tariffs: A New Chapter for Japanese Exports to the U.S.? The concept of a ‚Äúreciprocal tariff‚Äù is central to Trump‚Äôs recent announcement regarding the US Japan trade deal . Essentially, a reciprocal tariff implies that if one country imposes a tariff on goods from another, the second country can impose an equivalent tariff on goods from the first. In this case, Trump‚Äôs statement suggests that Japanese goods entering the U.S. would face a 15% levy, with the expectation that U.S. goods entering Japan would face a similar rate. This approach is often touted as a way to ensure fairness and balance in trade relations. For Japan, a 15% tariff on its exports to the U.S. could present significant challenges. The U.S. is a crucial market for many Japanese industries, particularly in sectors such as: Automobiles: Japanese car manufacturers have a substantial presence in the U.S. market. Increased tariffs could raise costs or force companies to rethink supply chains. Electronics: Japan is a leading exporter of high-tech electronics. A 15% tariff could make these products less competitive against domestic or other international alternatives. The direct consequence could be higher prices for American consumers on Japanese goods, or reduced profit margins for Japanese companies, potentially leading to shifts in manufacturing locations or export strategies. The precise impact would depend on how these tariffs are applied and whether exceptions or phase-ins are part of the eventual agreement. The Promise of $550 Billion: A Potential Boost for the U.S. Economy? Beyond the tariffs, the most eye-catching element of Trump‚Äôs announcement about the US Japan trade deal is the claimed $550 billion in Japanese investment into the U.S. economy. This figure, if substantiated and materialized, would represent an enormous financial commitment, dwarfing many previous foreign direct investment initiatives. Such a substantial investment could have profound and far-reaching positive effects across various sectors of the American economy. Where might this colossal sum be directed? Historically, Japanese investment in the U.S. has focused on manufacturing, technology, and finance. A $550 billion pledge could potentially expand these areas significantly, leading to: Job Creation: New facilities and expanded operations would necessitate a substantial increase in the workforce. Infrastructure Development: Parts of this investment could be channeled into modernizing U.S. infrastructure. Technological Advancement: Japanese companies are at the forefront of various technologies; investment could spur innovation and technology transfer. Economic Stimulus: The sheer volume of capital injection would act as a significant stimulus, boosting economic activity and GDP growth. While the prospect of such a massive investment is exciting, the specifics of its allocation, timeline, and the mechanisms for its realization would be critical details. The commitment of this scale would likely involve long-term planning and collaboration between governments and private sectors, making it a key element to watch in the evolving economic relationship between the two nations. Is This Truly a ‚ÄúNew Deal‚Äù or a Continuation of Trade Dialogues? The framing of this announcement as a ‚Äúnew deal‚Äù by Donald Trump raises questions about its relationship to existing trade agreements and ongoing dialogues between the U.S. and Japan. Historically, trade relations between the two countries have been complex. The U.S. withdrew from the Trans-Pacific Partnership (TPP) under the Trump administration, and subsequently, the U.S. and Japan entered into the U.S.-Japan Trade Agreement (USJTA) and the U.S.-Japan Digital Trade Agreement in 2020. These agreements addressed specific areas but did not encompass all aspects of a broad free trade agreement. So, is this a genuinely fresh start for the US Japan trade deal , or a re-negotiation and expansion of previous understandings? Trump‚Äôs rhetoric often emphasizes breaking from the past and forging entirely new agreements. However, international trade negotiations are typically incremental. The details of this ‚Äúnew deal‚Äù would need to clarify how it interacts with or supersedes the USJTA and other bilateral arrangements. It could represent an ambitious push to address areas not fully covered by previous agreements, or a political declaration of intent that sets the stage for future, more formal negotiations. The announcement underscores the political narrative surrounding trade, where leaders often seek to demonstrate strength and secure perceived advantages for their domestic economies. Navigating the Economic Currents: Potential Benefits, Challenges, and Global Implications of the US Japan Trade Deal Any significant shift in international trade policy, such as the proposed US Japan trade deal , creates a ripple effect of both potential benefits and considerable challenges for the economies involved and the global market at large. Analyzing these aspects is crucial for understanding the full scope of Trump‚Äôs announcement. Potential Benefits for the U.S.: Reduced Trade Deficit: If tariffs are effective, they could make Japanese imports less attractive, potentially encouraging U.S. consumers to opt for domestically produced goods. Domestic Industry Growth: The promised $550 billion investment could directly stimulate growth in various U.S. industries, leading to new facilities and stronger domestic supply chains. Increased Economic Leverage: An assertive trade stance, coupled with significant investment pledges, could provide the U.S. with greater leverage in future trade negotiations. Potential Challenges for Japan: Export Competitiveness: A 15% tariff on goods entering the U.S. could severely impact the competitiveness of Japanese products, forcing companies to absorb costs or reduce profit margins. Supply Chain Disruptions: Industries with complex global supply chains might face significant disruptions as companies seek to reconfigure their production networks. Risk of Retaliation: Such tariffs could be perceived negatively by other trading partners, potentially leading to a broader escalation of protectionist measures globally. Broader Implications for Global Markets: The announcement could also influence global trade dynamics, potentially signaling a renewed focus on bilateral trade agreements over multilateral ones, leading to a more fragmented global trading system. The tariffs could trigger concerns about protectionism, potentially leading to a ‚Äòtariff war‚Äô scenario that stifles global economic growth. From an investment perspective, a massive Japanese investment in the U.S. could divert capital that might otherwise have flowed to other regions. The stability and predictability of international trade relations are crucial for investor confidence, and any perceived instability could lead to market volatility. While not directly linked to daily cryptocurrency price movements, significant shifts in global trade policy and economic sentiment can indirectly influence the broader financial markets, including the sentiment towards digital assets as alternative investments or safe havens. Concluding Thoughts: The Evolving Landscape of US-Japan Economic Ties Donald Trump‚Äôs announcement of a new US Japan trade deal , featuring 15% reciprocal tariffs and a monumental $550 billion Japanese investment, marks a potentially transformative moment in the economic relationship between these two powerful nations. While the specifics of the agreement and its implementation remain to be fully detailed, the broad strokes paint a picture of an assertive U.S. trade policy aimed at rebalancing economic flows and securing significant foreign capital. The coming months will be critical as details emerge regarding the precise scope of the tariffs, the allocation and timeline of the promised investment, and how these new terms will integrate with or supersede existing trade agreements. For businesses, consumers, and investors alike, understanding these developments will be paramount. The deal has the potential to reshape supply chains, influence consumer prices, and significantly impact job markets in both countries. Beyond the bilateral relationship, this announcement could also serve as a blueprint or a cautionary tale for future international trade negotiations, underscoring the dynamic and often unpredictable nature of global economic diplomacy. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) Q1: What is the core of the new US Japan trade deal announced by Trump? A1: The core of the announced deal includes a 15% reciprocal tariff on goods Japan exports to the U.S., along with a claimed $550 billion in Japanese investment into the U.S. economy. Q2: What does ‚Äúreciprocal tariff‚Äù mean in this context? A2: A reciprocal tariff means that if the U.S. imposes a 15% tariff on Japanese goods, Japan would also impose a 15% tariff on U.S. goods entering its market, aiming for a balanced approach to trade barriers. Q3: How much investment is Japan supposedly committing to the U.S. economy? A3: According to Donald Trump‚Äôs statement, the arrangement includes a substantial $550 billion in Japanese investment in the U.S. economy. Q4: What are the potential benefits of this US Japan trade deal for the U.S.? A4: Potential benefits for the U.S. include a reduced trade deficit, significant job creation through investment, and enhanced domestic industry growth. Q5: What challenges might Japan face under these new terms? A5: Japan might face challenges related to the competitiveness of its exports due to tariffs, potential disruptions to its global supply chains, and the risk of broader protectionist measures from other trading partners. Q6: How might this deal impact global trade relations generally? A6: This deal could signal a shift towards more bilateral trade agreements, potentially fragmenting the global trading system. It might also raise concerns about protectionism, influencing other nations‚Äô trade policies and global capital flows. Did you find this analysis of the US Japan trade deal insightful? Share your thoughts and this article on social media to keep the conversation going and inform others about these significant economic developments! To learn more about the latest global economic policies and their impact on market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping international trade and investment. This post Unveiling the Monumental US Japan Trade Deal: Trump‚Äôs Bold 15% Tariffs and $550B Investment first appeared on BitcoinWorld and is written by Editorial Team

title: Elon Musk‚Äôs xAI is partnering with Valor Equity to raise an additional $12B
body: Elon Musk is reportedly seeking up to $12‚ÄØbillion, just weeks after raising $10‚ÄØbillion for xAI to stay competitive in the costly AI race. Insiders say xAI has partnered with Valor Equity Partners, led by Antonio Gracias, to structure a potential $12‚ÄØbillion capital raise to support its expansion as per a WSJ report. Following a $10 billion raise earlier, these future funds would buy a large batch of high-end Nvidia GPUs. xAI plans to lease them to build and run a huge data center for training and powering Grok. Musk recently posted on X, ‚ÄúxAI‚Äôs goal is to deploy 50‚ÄØmillion H100‚Äëequivalent compute units (with much better power efficiency) within five years.‚Äù Facing well‚Äëfunded competitors, Google, Microsoft, and Meta, Grok has struggled to find a foothold and recently sparked backlash when it shared racist and controversial posts on X. xAI has since issued an apology for ‚Äúhorrific behavior.‚Äù To strengthen xAI‚Äôs strained balance sheet, Musk has reallocated capital across his businesses. SpaceX invested $2‚ÄØbillion in xAI, and last month xAI used Grok‚Äôs IP to secure $5‚ÄØbillion in debt. Analysts warn that xAI will likely require additional capital in the near term, due to the steep expenses of large‚Äëscale model training. Rather than tapping third‚Äëparty cloud platforms like OpenAI and Anthropic do, xAI is opting to develop and manage its own hardware backbone. xAI faces massive burn rate but minimal revenue xAI is spending nearly all of its income, about $13‚ÄØbillion burned in 2025. However, it is still unprofitable with very little revenue so far. The proposal to finance GPUs via a structured lease‚Äëfinancing arrangement could trim billions from initial capital outlays, but at the expense of ongoing payment obligations. Despite the risks, investors remain confident in Musk‚Äôs track record with SpaceX and Tesla, recalling how he‚Äôs rewarded them before. Some even anticipate he‚Äôd tap other ventures to strengthen xAI if necessary. In only 122 days, xAI built its first huge data center, Colossus in Memphis, Tennessee, equipping it with 100,000 Nvidia GPUs. 92 days later, capacity was boosted to 200,000 units. Last year, Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang called it ‚Äúsuperhuman‚Äù and said, ‚ÄúElon is singular in his understanding of engineering and construction and large systems and marshalling resources.‚Äù xAI has outlined ambitions for a million‚ÄëGPUs powering Grok. For the next phase, Colossus‚ÄØ2, it‚Äôs again engaging Valor, whose capital has previously flowed into SpaceX, Tesla, SolarCity, The Boring Company, and Neuralink. The structure calls for Valor, alongside other buyout firms set up a fund that borrows billions to buy GPUs. xAI would then make lease payments or risk having the hardware taken back. What happens if xAI can‚Äôt pay its debts? Valor is negotiating with various private‚Äëcredit pools, aiming to finalize terms shortly, though insiders caution the arrangement could still fall apart. Creditors are worried about how big the loan is and how long it lasts. They want it paid back in three years with borrowing limits, since AI chips lose value fast as newer models appear and demand shifts. During its latest $5‚ÄØbillion debt placement , xAI raised money with bonds and loans backed by its data centers, GPU inventory, and the Grok IP. They offered a 12.5% yield, showing investors demanded a big premium for the risk. Should xAI default, creditors could rent Colossus‚Äô infrastructure to alternative AI operators and seize rights to the Grok model, which underpins several of Musk‚Äôs projects. Moreover, that financing arrangement limits xAI‚Äôs future borrowing at $5‚ÄØbillion, aside from any new GPU leases. Cryptopolitan Academy: Tired of market swings? title: SharpLink Gaming‚Äôs Ethereum Holdings Surge After Record Weekly Purchase
body: The company led by Ethereum co-founder Joseph Lubin has purchased 79,949 ETH. Its portfolio has now grown to 360,807 ETH. SharpLink Gaming launched its Ethereum strategy in early June 2025. SharpLink Gaming, the world's largest corporate holder of Ethereum, announced that its holdings reached 360,807 ETH as of July 20, 2025, up 29% from the previous week. According to the weekly report, the company purchased 79,949 ETH at an average price of $3,238, marking the largest weekly purchase volume in its history. Since the launch of its digital treasury strategy on June 2, 2025, SharpLink has also received 567 ETH in staking rewards. It is worth noting that in June, SharpLink¬†acquired more than 176,000 ETH for $463 million and became the largest public owner of Ethereum. At the same time, $96.6 million received under the At-The-Market (ATM) program has not yet been used for purchases and will be deployed to further increase crypto reserves. ‚ÄúWe continue to strategically use our ATM facility to grow Ethereum reserves as part of our long-term growth objectives. The asset‚Äôs strong position and our ability to purchase large volumes at favorable prices support our goal of increasing Ethereum concentration and shareholder value through disciplined execution of our treasury strategy,‚Äù said SharpLink Chairman Joseph Lubin, Ethereum co-founder and Consensys CEO. Additionally, SharpLink expressed its appreciation for the recent signing by US President Donald Trump of the Guiding and Establishing National Innovation for US Stablecoins (GENIUS Act), which establishes a clear regulatory framework for digital assets in the US. Let us recall that Trump recently¬†signed the corresponding law. ‚ÄúThe GENIUS Act opens a new era for the digital asset industry. We believe that the regulatory uncertainty that has held back innovation in the crypto space will now disappear. This creates an enabling environment for companies like SharpLink that are leveraging the benefits of Ethereum‚Äîincluding security, scalability, and smart contract functionality‚Äîto transform the global digital economy,‚Äù Lubin added. The second-largest cryptocurrency by market cap is trading at $3,691, according to TradingView at the time of writing. Thus, SharpLink's unrealized profit amounts to more than $1.3 billion.

title: Trump hails landmark Indonesia trade deal as boost for American jobs and exports
body: Indonesia has committed to removing tariffs on more than 99% of US goods and eliminating all non-tariff barriers facing American companies. On the other hand, the United States will cut its proposed tariffs on Indonesian imports from 32% to 19%. This agreement is under the deal described in the release as an ‚Äú Agreement on Reciprocal Trade .‚Äù Trump hails landmark trade deal as boost for American jobs and exports President Donald Trump celebrated the deal as a major victory for American industries. ‚ÄúA huge win for our Automakers, Tech Companies, Workers, Farmers, Ranchers, and Manufacturers,‚Äù he posted on Truth Social. A joint statement and a White House fact sheet detailed the accord‚Äôs framework, noting that negotiators will finalize the full agreement in the coming weeks. ‚ÄúThe United States of America and the Republic of Indonesia agreed to a framework‚Ä¶ which will provide both countries‚Äô exporters unprecedented access to each other‚Äôs markets,‚Äù the statement read. During this period, they will also ‚Äúprepare the agreement for signature and complete domestic procedures required for it to enter into force,‚Äù the statement said. The newly released framework closely reflects the terms Trump outlined last week on social media, when he claimed to have ‚Äúfinalized‚Äù a deal with Indonesia following a conversation with its president, Prabowo Subianto. Deal includes $18B in commercial agreements and major policy shifts Tuesday‚Äôs formal statement revealed that the framework includes a series of upcoming commercial agreements between the United States and Indonesia, such as a $3.2 billion aircraft purchase and approximately $15 billion in energy product deals. The agreement also outlines plans to tackle various non-tariff barriers and other challenges American companies face in accessing Indonesia‚Äôs markets. According to the Commerce Department, Indonesia ranks among the top 25 US trading partners, with over $38 billion in goods exchanged in 2024. The US trade deficit with Indonesia stood at $17.9 billion last year. US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer noted that today‚Äôs announcement shows that America can defend its domestic production while obtaining expansive market access with its trading partners. The agreement is one of the few completed by the Trump administration before the August 1 deadline for planned tariff hikes. The new US tariff rate for Indonesia‚ÄîSoutheast Asia‚Äôs largest economy‚Äînow matches the 19% rate set for the Philippines, while Vietnam faces a 20% rate . However, the countries involved have yet to confirm the terms the White House outlined officially officially. Meanwhile, Trump has issued letters to major US trade partners warning of significant tariff hikes set to take effect on August 1. Indonesia will drop plans to levy tariffs on internet data flows as part of the deal. It supports the renewal of the World Trade Organization‚Äôs moratorium on e-commerce duties. The country will also remove pre-shipment inspections and verifications that hindered US agricultural exports, which officials say could help restore a previously held surplus in American farm goods. In a boost for the US auto industry, Indonesia has agreed to accept US Federal Motor Vehicle Safety Standards for vehicles exported to its market of 280 million people. Additionally, Indonesia will lift export restrictions on industrial commodities, including critical minerals, and eliminate local content requirements for products containing those materials when shipped to the US. The agreement also commits Indonesia to removing import restrictions and licensing requirements on US remanufactured goods and parts. It has further agreed to join the Global Forum on Steel Excess Capacity and take action to address global oversupply in the steel sector. The joint statement noted that the US could identify certain commodities not naturally available or produced domestically for further tariff reductions. Both countries also plan to negotiate rules of origin to ensure that the deal‚Äôs benefits are limited to US and Indonesian producers, and not extended to third-party nations. title: Tron‚Äôs Justin Sun to Fly on Blue Origin‚Äôs Next Crewed Mission
body: Tron founder Justin Sun will join the next Blue Origin crewed flight, the company announced Tuesday. He is the latest high-profile figure to board Jeff Bezos‚Äô New Shepard rocket. Sun won the first New Shepard seat in a 2021 auction with a $28 million bid that funded 19 space-focused charities, but couldn‚Äôt attend the July 2021 flight due to a scheduling conflict. He will fly alongside real estate investor Arvi Bahal, Turkish businessman G√∂khan Erdem, Puerto Rican meteorologist Deborah Martorell, UK-born nonprofit founder Lionel Pitchford, and venture capitalist J.D. Russell on the NS-34 mission. Another Billionaire Heads to Space In its official press release, Blue Origin revealed that this will be the 14th human flight for its New Shepard program and the 34th in its overall flight history, with the launch date to be announced. The mission will add six more individuals to the 70 people Blue Origin has flown past the K√°rm√°n line, the internationally recognized boundary of space. Sun was featured on Forbes‚Äô April 2025 cover as one of crypto‚Äôs most outspoken figures. He joins a growing roster of entrepreneurs, philanthropists, and celebrities who have flown with Blue Origin, which has included William Shatner, Michael Strahan, Katy Perry, and Gayle King in previous missions. From Sculpture Disputes to Eating a $5M Banana Earlier this year, Sun filed a lawsuit against music mogul David Geffen in Manhattan federal court to reclaim or receive up to $80 million in damages for an Alberto Giacometti sculpture he claims was stolen and sold without his consent. The Tron founder alleged that a former aide, Xiong Zihan Sydney, forged documents and used a fake lawyer to execute the sale of the Le Nez sculpture, and swapped it for Geffen‚Äôs art and cash worth around $65.5 million. Geffen‚Äôs legal team, however, called the lawsuit ‚Äúbizarre and baseless,‚Äù while rejecting Sun‚Äôs claims and denying any wrongdoing in the dispute. Last November, Sun bought one of three limited edition rights to Maurizio Cattelan‚Äôs Comedian ‚Äì the 2019 artwork showing a banana duct-taped to a wall at a New York auction for $5.2 million. Not long after the purchase, he publicly ate the banana on stage. He also pledged to buy 100,000 bananas from the New York street vendor who had initially provided the fruit for the artwork. The post Tron‚Äôs Justin Sun to Fly on Blue Origin‚Äôs Next Crewed Mission appeared first on CryptoPotato .

title: Why betting on Bitcoin as the dollar collapses could wreck small investors
body: The value of the US dollar is dropping as inflation rises, making it difficult for people to afford basic needs more and more each day. As a result, experts say individuals are now turning to Bitcoin (BTC) as a safe place to store money because it has a limited supply that no government or bank can control. In the same way, prominent investors like Tim Draper now promote BTC as the future of money and say its value will continue to grow steadily for years to come as more people lose trust in traditional banks and fiat currencies. Draper and other cryptocurrency leaders further claim that people will have no choice but to adopt a decentralized, digital alternative like BTC. This is because the dollar will eventually collapse under the weight of endless printing and poor financial policies. The situation raises a serious question that every ordinary person should ask themselves before putting their limited savings into Bitcoin: Does digital currency hide dangers that could destroy the wealth people are trying to save? Bitcoin looks safe for several reasons People think BTC can‚Äôt suffer from inflation like normal money because it‚Äôs designed so that only 21 million coins will ever exist, so no governments, banks, or creators can produce more. They also think that powerful organizations cannot freeze, steal, or manipulate their money, as transactions happen on a blockchain public ledger without any bank or official approval. On top of this, people want to escape the traditional banking system after seeing economic crises where large companies got bailouts while ordinary people lost their homes and savings. Tim Draper predicts BTC will become the new standard for saving and spending money in a digital world within the next 10 to 20 years, after the US dollar completely disappears as a trusted global currency. All these factors convince people that buying BTC is necessary to protect their money and secure their future in a world where they feel the old financial rules no longer work in their favor. Bitcoin price swings hurt small investors Most people only hear about times when Bitcoin‚Äôs price hits a new record and forget that in between those records are massive crashes where the value can drop by 50%, 80%, or even more in just a few weeks or months. Large investors have enough money to hold their BTC for years and wait for a recovery when the price crashes suddenly. However, small investors don‚Äôt have that luxury because they need their small savings for daily expenses, emergencies, or life plans like school fees and medical bills. Faced with this challenge, they must sell during the downturn, locking in heavy losses that can destroy their financial stability for years. There are also no safety nets with cryptocurrencies to protect small investors when hackers steal their BTC, lose due to forgotten passwords, or are trapped in a platform that shuts down suddenly (as has happened many times). Because of this, small investors who lack the technical skills to keep their BTC safe or who trust unreliable online platforms to store their coins without realizing the risks involved lose all their money permanently without any chance of getting it back. Small investors also struggle to sell their coins fast enough to avoid losses when Bitcoin‚Äôs price drops sharply. This is because trading platforms slow down, and the markets get overwhelmed by millions of people trying to sell simultaneously. Finally, a psychological effect known as FOMO, or ‚Äúfear of missing out,‚Äù caused by the hype and stories of people becoming millionaires overnight, pushes small investors to buy Bitcoin at exactly the wrong moment when prices are at their highest and everyone else is rushing to buy. The same investors experience fear and panic, and sell their Bitcoin at a much lower price just to avoid losing more when prices start falling quickly. Bitcoin offers no short-term financial security Many famous investors say that Bitcoin could one day reach prices like $250,000 or even more, and get people excited, especially those worried about losing their money because of inflation and unstable economies. Many small investors do not realize that their predictions do not help people who need short-term financial security or cannot afford to leave their money tied up in Bitcoin for years without using it. Ordinary people think the price will quickly go up and solve their money problems when they put their limited savings into Bitcoin, but the coin causes short-term pain due to its high price volatility and unpredictable cycles of booms and crashes. Bitcoin‚Äôs price history clearly shows that after each big rise, there can be long periods (sometimes months or even years) when the price remains low or falls further, forcing investors to wait for a recovery that may take much longer than expected. Small investors who need access to their money for daily living will have to sell their Bitcoin at a loss just to meet their basic needs. Experts also base long-term forecasts about Bitcoin on assumptions that may not come true. Bitcoin‚Äôs future depends on many factors that ordinary people cannot control or predict, like government regulations, technical failures, competition from other cryptocurrencies, and changes in investor behavior. Small investors gamble their limited savings on a future that may or may not arrive and suffer the most because they cannot afford to wait and recover like wealthier investors can. Scammers steal from small investors in crypto markets Criminals create fake coins with professional-looking websites, fake celebrity endorsements, and promises of fast returns to lure small investors who do not have the time or experience to investigate whether the coins are real. These tokens disappear overnight once the scammers have collected enough money from their victims. Criminals also create fake websites or send fake emails that look like real exchanges or wallet providers to get small investors to enter their passwords or wallet keys, so they can steal that information and use it to take all the Bitcoin or crypto from the investors‚Äô accounts. Most small investors have no way to trace the criminals or get any help from the authorities because many governments lack clear rules or systems to protect people in these situations. Small investors are easy targets for these scams because there are no strong rules or safety nets to protect them from the fake platforms that operate with little or no oversight. On the other hand, big investors, such as hedge funds and wealthy individuals, usually have teams of lawyers, financial advisors, and cybersecurity experts to help them avoid scams and navigate the complex world of crypto safely. Scammers specifically target small investors because they know these people are desperate to protect their money from inflation and financial uncertainty, and they exploit that fear by promising safety and quick profits. Bitcoin may rise later, but small investors suffer now Small investors must understand that the present reality of investing in Bitcoin is filled with serious risks. This means they could easily wipe out their limited savings long before they can benefit from Bitcoin‚Äôs long-term potential. Bitcoin brings dangers that are often ignored or hidden in all the excitement, even though it is true that the dollar is losing value and people are understandably looking for safer alternatives to protect their money. Small investors should step back and understand that protecting their savings is more important than chasing future profits. Instead of rushing into Bitcoin because of bold predictions or social media hype. The path to Bitcoin‚Äôs future victory could be filled with painful losses for people not financially prepared for its dangerous ups and downs today. In simple words, Bitcoin might win in the long run, but small investors could lose everything on the way there. KEY Difference Wire helps crypto brands break through and dominate headlines fast

title: Expert Predicts XRP Could Reach $2,000 by This Date
body: Jake Claver, CEO of Digital Ascension Group, has shared a highly optimistic price forecast for XRP, suggesting the cryptocurrency could reach between $1,500 and $2,000 by early 2026. His comments were made during an interview on The Good Morning Crypto show, where he outlined a series of macroeconomic and geopolitical factors that he believes could drive such an increase. Macroeconomic Pressures and Regulatory Shifts Claver‚Äôs projection rests on the assumption that major structural changes in the global financial system will occur. One such factor is the potential unwinding of the reverse carry trade, a financial strategy involving borrowing at low interest rates in one currency to invest in assets with higher returns elsewhere. He believes a reversal in this strategy could shift liquidity in favor of digital assets like XRP. Another key point in his analysis involves regulatory developments surrounding stablecoins. Claver speculated that Tether, a widely used stablecoin, may come under increased scrutiny. He suggested that a joint investigation or hearing could take place involving the SEC, CFTC, and Department of Justice, potentially triggered by the recent passage of the GENIUS Act . In his view, any negative findings related to Tether could affect market stability and cause investors to seek safer, more transparent assets. Additionally, Claver mentioned that ongoing legal disclosures related to the Jeffrey Epstein case could have a knock-on effect within the financial sector. Though he did not draw a direct connection, he implied that any unexpected revelations involving crypto firms might impact investor trust and market behavior. Liquidity Concerns and XRP‚Äôs Use in Settlement Claver also referenced a long-debated theory originally put forward by Shane Ellis. The theory claims that liquidity shortages on crypto exchanges, such as Bitfinex, could cause XRP‚Äôs price to surge unexpectedly, an argument previously used to justify high price predictions like the $589 figure. Expanding on XRP‚Äôs practical use, Claver argued that the token is well-suited for solving settlement inefficiencies in traditional finance. While stock trades typically settle after one business day, digital asset settlements, including XRP, can be completed within 20 to 40 minutes. He highlighted the importance of real-time settlement, particularly during periods when traditional markets are closed, such as weekends or holidays. He also pointed to Project ION, a blockchain-based settlement platform developed through a collaboration between R3 and the DTCC, as an example of infrastructure that could benefit from a neutral and liquid bridge asset. According to Claver, XRP could serve that purpose, enabling cross-platform financial connectivity when needed most. We are on twitter, follow us to connect with us :- @TimesTabloid1 ‚Äî TimesTabloid (@TimesTabloid1) July 15, 2023 Rising oil prices, possibly driven by geopolitical tensions in the Middle East, were also cited as a contributing factor that could accelerate financial instability and push more investors toward alternative assets like XRP. Evaluating the Feasibility of a $2,000 Price Target Despite the elaborate framework behind Claver‚Äôs prediction, his targets remain extraordinary by current market standards. With XRP trading near $3.45 at the time of his remarks, reaching $1,500 would require an increase of over 43,000%, while a $2,000 price point would mark a rise of more than 57,000%. Such prices would also result in unprecedented market capitalizations. At $1,500, XRP‚Äôs total market cap would surpass $90 trillion, roughly four times the current value of the global gold market. At $2,000, XRP would be valued at $120 trillion, exceeding the estimated global M2 money supply. Though the likelihood of reaching these figures is widely debated, Claver‚Äôs outlook has sparked interest for its boldness. Under this scenario, a modest holding of 1,000 XRP , currently valued around $3,450, could grow into a portfolio worth $1.5 to $2 million, depending on which target is reached. Jake Claver‚Äôs forecast represents one of the more aggressive XRP price predictions in recent memory. While his rationale draws from legitimate economic and regulatory trends, the projected valuations are ambitious and have generated both curiosity and skepticism. Times Tabloid is not responsible for any financial losses. title: Analyst Predicts Explosive 126% Shiba Inu Rally After SHIB Surpasses Litecoin Market Cap
body: Crypto analyst Maddox has provided a bullish outlook for Shiba Inu, predicting an explosive rally. His prediction comes as SHIB surpasses Litecoin to climb into the 18th spot on the list of largest cryptocurrencies by market capitalization. Shiba Inu Eyes Explosive 126% Rally In a TradingView post, Maddox predicted that Shiba Inu could record a 126% rally to $0.0003579 from its current price level. The analyst noted that SHIB has printed confirmed weekly bullish divergence in the Relative Strength Index (RSI). The top meme coin is now attempting to overcome the weekly 200EMA resistance. Related Reading: Shiba Inu Breakout Programmed: Diamond Hands Are Up 783%, SHIB Burn Rate Explodes 1,784% The analyst further revealed that a High Volume Node lies just above, and a close above this level will signal a bullish trend. Based on this bullish trend, Shiba Inu could move to the initial target of the weekly pivot at $0.00001774 before it then moves to the $0.0000579 High Volume Node. Meanwhile, Maddox noted that the Shiba Inu price has completed its retracement to the ‚Äòalt-coin‚Äô golden pocket 0.786 Fibonacci retracement. He added that a bearish divergence is currently growing on the weekly RSI but that this will be diverted with a thrust high. The analyst is confident in SHIB‚Äôs potential, suggesting that this is a MEME season. He noted that the Dogecoin price looks ready to go. As such, Shiba Inu is also expected to follow suit, given the correlation between these meme coins, which are the largest ones by market cap. DOGE is up over 38% in the last seven days. Shiba Inu has followed and is up over 16% during this period. Thanks to the current uptrend, SHIB has surpassed LTC to become the 18th largest crypto by market cap. The meme coin currently boasts a market cap of $8.89 billion. SHIB Ready To Run To The $0.000032 Levels Crypto analyst Javon Marks had earlier shared a similar prediction to Maddox‚Äôs. In an X post, he declared that in the nearer term and by confirmed data, the $0.000032s are levels to come for Shiba Inu in response to a bullish divergence. He added that this 135% move could only be the start of a larger bullish reversal for the foremost meme coin. Related Reading: Shiba Inu Price Could See 180% Explosion As This Indicator Flashes Bullish Divergence Crypto analyst Friedrich suggested that Shiba Inu could reach its all-time high (ATH) as part of this larger bullish reversal. In an X post, the analyst declared that SHIB is about to blast. He added that with Ethereum ripping, the meme coin will go for a retest of its ATH of $0.00008845 for sure. His accompanying chart showed that SHIB could at least reach $0.00008032. At the time of writing, the Shiba Inu price is trading at around $0.0000151, down over 3% in the last 24 hours, according to data from CoinMarketCap. title: JPMorgan Chase‚Äôs Plans for Charging Fintechs for Customer Account Data Raising Concerns With at Least One CFPB Official: Report
body: One official at a federal consumer protection agency is reportedly raising concerns over JPMorgan Chase‚Äôs plan to charge fintech fees for customers‚Äô account data. An unnamed politically appointed official with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) believes the agency‚Äôs efforts to kill in court an open banking rule enacted under former US President Biden may be giving JPMorgan Chase the opportunity to charge the fees, reports Bloomberg. The same official is discussing the issue with concerned fintech firms, according to multiple sources who asked to remain anonymous to talk about the controversial matter. The CFPB open banking rule, which was finalized last year, prevents banks from imposing charges on third parties such as Coinbase, Venmo and PayPal to access customers‚Äô deposit and credit card account information as a way to ensure competition. However, CFPB‚Äôs Acting Director Russell Vought is now asking a federal judge to vacate the rule on several grounds, arguing that Section 1033 of the Dodd-Frank Act ‚Äúdoes not authorize the Bureau to prohibit banks from charging any fees for maintaining and providing access through the required developer interfaces.‚Äù Critics of JPMorgan Chase‚Äôs fee proposal say it could stifle the fintech sector. Graham Steele, the former assistant Treasury secretary for financial institutions in the Biden administration, says the Trump administration‚Äôs efforts to shutter the CFPB and delete Biden-related policies are wreaking havoc in the fintech industry. ‚ÄúBy repealing the rule without fully thinking it through, they have caused a lot of problems in the marketplace and for consumers.‚Äù The CFPB did not respond to the media‚Äôs request for comment at time of publication. Meanwhile, JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon defended the fee proposal during the bank‚Äôs second-quarter earnings call. ‚ÄúIt just costs a lot of money to set up the APIs and stuff like that to run the system protection.‚Äù Critics of the bank fees include cryptocurrency companies and investors. Says Alex Rampell, a general partner at venture capital firm Andreessen Horowitz, ‚ÄúMake no mistake: this isn‚Äôt about a new revenue stream. It‚Äôs about strangling competition. And if they get away with this, every bank will follow.‚Äù Follow us on X , Facebook and Telegram Don't Miss a Beat ‚Äì Subscribe to get email alerts delivered directly to your inbox Check Price Action Surf The Daily Hodl Mix Disclaimer: Opinions expressed at The Daily Hodl are not investment advice. title: Microsoft poaches Amar Subramanya, ex-head of Gemini at Google, as VP of AI
body: Microsoft has hired more than 20 artificial intelligence pros from Google‚Äôs DeepMind unit in the past six months, intensifying Silicon Valley‚Äôs escalating race for elite AI talent. The recruitment wave includes Amar Subramanya, former head of engineering for Google‚Äôs Gemini chatbot, who announced his move to Microsoft this week in a LinkedIn post. ‚ÄúThe culture here is refreshingly low ego yet bursting with ambition,‚Äù Subramanya wrote, confirming his appointment as corporate vice-president of AI. He joins a growing cohort of former Google DeepMind staff now embedded within Microsoft‚Äôs AI division, including engineering lead Sonal Gupta, software engineer Adam Sadovsky, and product manager Tim Frank. According to people familiar with the matter, Microsoft has attracted at least 24 AI specialists from DeepMind alone since early 2025. The move is part of a strategic talent push by Microsoft as Big Tech groups race to outpace each other in the development of artificial general intelligence (AGI) and commercial AI applications. Microsoft recruits AI talent with attractive compensation Microsoft‚Äôs recruiting spree is part of a strategy led by Mustafa Suleyman, co-founder of DeepMind, who joined Microsoft in March after the company acquired most of the staff and IP from his AI startup Inflection for $650 million. The fierce battle for AI talent has pushed salaries for elite engineers and scientists into the stratosphere. Recent reports estimate that top AI researchers now command total compensation packages upwards of $10 million to $20 million annually, comparable to star athletes and hedge fund managers. In a public spat earlier this year, OpenAI CEO Sam Altman criticized Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg for encouraging ‚Äúmercenary‚Äù hiring practices after the Facebook parent offered $100 million sign-on bonuses to lure developers from rival labs. Subramanya‚Äôs departure, alongside fellow Gemini engineering co-lead Mat Velloso, who has since joined Meta, has prompted a leadership reshuffle within Google‚Äôs AI operations. The company is now under pressure to retain top-tier engineers as it continues to trail OpenAI and Anthropic in public adoption of its Gemini model, which lags behind ChatGPT‚Äôs hundreds of millions of monthly users, according to recent court filings. Google responds, but concerns linger In response to Microsoft‚Äôs aggressive hiring, Google maintains that DeepMind‚Äôs attrition rates remain below the industry average and claims to have recruited a comparable number of AI staff from rivals. However, the company has also taken steps to stem the outflow. According to a recent Business Insider report, DeepMind has quietly implemented stricter non-compete clauses for key AI staff, in some cases restricting employees from joining competitors for up to 12 months after departure. Critics argue such measures may prove legally flawed under U.S. labor laws, especially in California, where non-compete clauses are not enforceable. Also, critics argue that it could hamper collaboration in the research community. With Suleyman now in charge of Microsoft‚Äôs AI for consumer products, the company is betting heavily on its ability to outbuild Google and Meta in the next wave of smart assistants, productivity tools, and health applications. Google, while still dominant in search and advertising, faces a growing perception that it has stumbled in translating its foundational research into breakthrough products. The growing exodus of talent to Microsoft, Meta, and OpenAI may signal deeper concerns about culture, vision, or agility inside Google‚Äôs AI ranks. title: Arthur Hayes says stablecoins will finance Trump‚Äôs 'fascist
body: The U.S. economy is being rebuilt for war, and Arthur Hayes says crypto will be footing the bill. Not Bitcoin. Not Ether. Stablecoins. As Trump prepares to flood the system with credit to prop up defense production, Arthur argues that the buyers of this new wave of debt won‚Äôt be boomers or Wall Street, it‚Äôll be stablecoin issuers like Tether, quietly buying up Treasury bills with crypto inflows. To understand this mess, you need to understand where the new money is coming from. According to Arthur, it‚Äôs not about GDP, taxes. Trump is copying China‚Äôs model where the state guarantees profits for ‚Äúcritical industries‚Äù like semiconductors, rare earths, and weapons. That forces banks to lend because profit is guaranteed. And with credit flowing, the U.S. ramps up military production at scale. MP Materials shows how Trump‚Äôs fascist credit plan works The first test case is MP Materials. They got a $1 billion loan backed by JPMorgan and Goldman Sachs to build a rare earth processing plant. Why‚Äôd the banks agree? Because the Department of Defense stepped in and guaranteed a floor price for the minerals, double the Chinese market rate. Oh, and the Pentagon‚Äôs now the company‚Äôs biggest shareholder. The deal looks like this: MP borrows $1,000, which creates $1,000 in fresh fiat. That money is used to build the plant and pay workers. Those workers spend money, create more deposits, and keep the cycle going. Meanwhile, the government buys the rare earths from MP, financed by fresh Treasury debt. The banks convert MP‚Äôs loan into reserves at the Fed and use those reserves to buy the debt. Net result? The banking system, the government, and the company all get richer. The fiat supply grows. Welcome to QE for Poor People, as Arthur humorously calls it. Source: Arthur Hayes This method doesn‚Äôt need Congress. Trump‚Äôs Pentagon can sign off on procurement deals directly. Banks will line up to fund anything tagged ‚Äúcritical.‚Äù Politicians will fight to get contracts into their own districts. It‚Äôs the perfect engine for growth, and inflation. That‚Äôs the catch. As Arthur points out, credit creation outpaces actual production. Labor and materials don‚Äôt grow magically. Fiat does. So inflation comes next, and wages go up, goods get expensive, and people who aren‚Äôt plugged into the government-banking loop get screwed. But Arthur says there‚Äôs a way to mask the pain: blow a financial bubble. If you inflate an asset class fast enough, the public forgets they‚Äôre broke, as long as they feel richer. China did it with housing. The U.S. is going to do it with crypto. Credit growth will drive a crypto bubble, and stablecoins will buy the debt As the U.S. turns up the credit tap, Arthur says crypto will moon. He built an index combining U.S. bank reserves and liabilities, and mapped it to Bitcoin. When credit doubled, Bitcoin rose 15x. The more fiat the U.S. creates, the more crypto soars. The Trump team knows this too. That‚Äôs why they‚Äôve ‚Äúorange-pilled‚Äù themselves, as Arthur puts it. It‚Äôs strategic. More poor, young, and minority Americans own crypto than stocks. That means when crypto pumps, a broader slice of the population feels richer. Politically, that‚Äôs gold. Especially when paired with new policies like allowing 401(k) plans to hold crypto, a pool of $8.7 trillion. And Trump‚Äôs new proposal to eliminate capital gains taxes on crypto? That‚Äôs the final rocket booster. But folks, the masterstroke isn‚Äôt the pump, it‚Äôs the recycling. When crypto market cap rises, some of that cash goes into stablecoins. Arthur estimates 9% of total crypto value ends up in stablecoins. These stablecoins invest in short-term T-bills for yield; safe, short-dated, liquid. The more the market rises, the more stablecoin AUC grows, and the more Treasury bills get bought. If the crypto market hits $100 trillion by 2028, Arthur estimates $9 trillion will flow into stablecoins, which means $9 trillion of Treasury demand. ‚ÄúThat would be a 25x rise from current levels,‚Äù he says. That demand will be used to fund all of Trump‚Äôs military contracts, rare earth guarantees, and production subsidies. It‚Äôs not new. The U.S. did the same thing during World War II, they issued short-term bills instead of long-term bonds to fund the war. Back then it was war bonds and patriotism. Now it‚Äôs stablecoins and yield. So now the circle is closed. Trump triggers a wartime economy. The Fed doesn‚Äôt print, commercial banks do. They‚Äôre incentivized to lend by government guarantees. Credit booms. That credit pushes crypto higher. People pile into stablecoins. Stablecoin issuers buy T-bills. The government gets endless liquidity to fund its military-industrial complex. So if you‚Äôre still sitting on the sidelines, sipping light beer and watching the club go nuts without you, don‚Äôt. This is the Trump credit cycle. And if Arthur is right, stablecoins are the new war bonds. KEY Difference Wire helps crypto brands break through and dominate headlines fast

title: Trump seals trade deal with Japan, comes with economically bizarre conditions
body: Donald Trump announced on Tuesday that the United States and Japan had finalized what he described as the ‚Äúlargest Deal ever,‚Äù a sweeping trade agreement that includes new 15% reciprocal tariffs on all Japanese exports to the U.S. The news, of course shared by Trump on Truth Social, followed a weeks-long tariff threat campaign and came with a long list of unusual financial promises. According to Trump, Japan will inject $550 billion into the U.S. economy under this new agreement. He also claimed the U.S. would ‚Äúreceive 90% of the Profits.‚Äù The announcement, made from Washington, comes just days after Trump sent a formal tariff notice to Japan, warning that starting August 1, exports to the U.S. would be hit with a 25% tariff if no agreement was reached. That letter followed an earlier move on April 2, when Trump first revealed a 24% rate during what he called ‚ÄúLiberation Day‚Äù tariffs. The goal was clear: pressure Japan into offering more trade concessions or face even higher penalties. Trump‚Äôs statement on Tuesday confirmed that those tariffs would now instead be set at 15%, as part of a ‚Äúreciprocal‚Äù deal. Markets respond, tech earnings and housing data next Trump also said Japan had agreed to open up its markets ‚Äúto Trade including Cars and Trucks, Rice and certain other Agricultural Products, and other things.‚Äù He added that the deal would lead to the creation of ‚ÄúHundreds of Thousands of Jobs.‚Äù But no timeline or breakdown was provided for either the investment or the projected jobs. The White House has not released any official documentation detailing how the $550 billion investment will be managed or how the profit-sharing model will work. The auto sector is one of Japan‚Äôs key export engines. In 2024, Japanese car shipments made up 28.3% of the country‚Äôs total exports. Under current rules, Japanese automobiles shipped into the U.S. already face a 25% tariff, the same applied to all other countries. Trump‚Äôs new deal doesn‚Äôt remove that number but repackages it under a broader reciprocal framework. Market reaction was immediate. Futures for the Nikkei 225 in Chicago jumped to 40,185, compared to the index‚Äôs last close at 39,774.92. In Australia, the S&P/ASX 200 futures climbed to 8,681, slightly above the previous close of 8,677.20. Hong Kong‚Äôs Hang Seng futures also edged up to 25,321, improving from 25,130.03. In the U.S., S&P 500 futures moved up 0.2% by Tuesday evening after the news broke. Dow Jones futures rose 99 points, or 0.2%, while Nasdaq 100 futures hovered near the flatline. The broader investor reaction reflected interest, not celebration. That‚Äôs because everyone‚Äôs eyes are on the earnings calendar. Alphabet and Tesla are expected to report on Wednesday after the market closes. These will be the first major updates from megacap tech companies this earnings season. Traders are watching closely, since tech has led the rally for years. Ahead of that, Hasbro is expected to report before the bell, followed later by Chipotle Mexican Grill and Mattel. The earnings flow is heavy this week, and so far, about 17% of S&P 500 firms have reported‚Äîwith 85% beating expectations. Beyond corporate earnings, economic data is also on the docket. Traders are looking ahead to existing home sales data due Wednesday morning, which could offer a clearer view of the housing market‚Äôs direction, which is now more unaffordable than ever, as Cryptopolitan reported . title: Jim Cramer does a 180 on meme stocks. What's that about?
body: Wall Street‚Äôs Jim Cramer just flipped the script after years of bashing meme stocks like GameStop and AMC, by suddenly telling everyone on Tuesday night to stop shorting Kohl‚Äôs. Yeah, Kohl‚Äôs. The same department store chain that most people forgot even existed. ‚ÄúThe shorts have clearly overstepped their boundaries with Kohl‚Äôs. They‚Äôve run into a buzz-saw of their own creation,‚Äù Jim said. ‚ÄúEven now, I think they‚Äôd be wise to cover their short and move on before they have another GameStop on their hands.‚Äù That statement came right after Kohl‚Äôs stock went nuts. Trading was so volatile on Tuesday that it had to be temporarily halted. Once the dust settled, shares ended the day up a massive 37.62%. According to FactSet, roughly 50% of Kohl‚Äôs outstanding shares were sold short, making it a prime target for a squeeze. Cramer calls out short sellers over Kohl‚Äôs stock surge Let‚Äôs be clear. Jim wasn‚Äôt praising Kohl‚Äôs actual business. He straight-up said that the company‚Äôs partnerships with Sephora or Amazon weren‚Äôt driving the stock‚Äôs movement. Instead, he argued that the stock was being bought because of how heavily it was shorted. According to Jim, this was purely a momentum play built around short interest. He pointed out that Kohl‚Äôs had been discussed on the WallStreetBets subreddit, the same place that sparked the infamous 2021 short squeeze. He said the playbook looked identical. Back in 2021, the GameStop squeeze cost hedge funds close to $20 billion, driven by retail traders banding together online to force short sellers into panic-buying shares to close their positions. And here‚Äôs the weirdest part: Jim used to hate this kind of stuff. He was one of the loudest voices calling out meme stocks as hype machines. He regularly said names like GameStop and AMC were being driven by emotion, not numbers. He dismissed the POTUS‚Äô Trump Media & Technology Group (DJT) as ‚Äúovervalued‚Äù and said the moves weren‚Äôt backed by revenue or profits. Just a few years ago, Jim sided with the short sellers. He tried hard to talk down retail investor excitement during the GameStop frenzy. His 2021 take? Sell GameStop at $400. That got him roasted so badly online that a new meme was born: Inverse Cramer. Retail traders started doing the exact opposite of what he recommended. It became a whole thing. He was mocked all over Reddit, especially in the r/WallStreetBets community, for being the poster child of outdated investment thinking. So for him to now say hedge funds should ‚Äúcover and move on‚Äù feels like a full reversal. He believes the short position doesn‚Äôt match Kohl‚Äôs fundamentals, or retail power. There‚Äôs debt, and sales are slipping, but the company isn‚Äôt falling apart. And that‚Äôs his issue. He doesn‚Äôt think the target makes sense if you‚Äôre betting on total collapse. Jim also called out hedge funds directly, saying they should‚Äôve closed their shorts earlier this year when the stock dipped after Wall Street panicked about President Donald Trump‚Äôs new tariffs. That spring sell-off, according to him, was the time to exit. Not now. ‚ÄúIn the end, the short sellers have the wrong target,‚Äù Jim said. ‚ÄúA company with declining sales and a lot of debt, but not one that‚Äôs about to fall apart, which is what you need if you were still shorting Kohl‚Äôs down here in the single digits.‚Äù Your crypto news deserves attention - KEY Difference Wire puts you on 250+ top sites

title: Crypto prediction platform Polymarket is considering issuing its own stablecoin
body: Polymarket, the crypto-powered prediction market, is considering entering the stablecoin market with two options on the table. The first one is to introduce its own customized stablecoin, or accept a revenue-sharing deal with Circle based on the amount of USDC held on the platform. According to reports, Polymarket‚Äôs main drive for launching its stablecoin is to earn yield from the reserves that currently benefit Circle. By issuing a native token, the platform could keep that revenue in-house. Polymarket considering its own stablecoin. Stablecoin entry could enhance liquidity in prediction markets, providing native economic incentives. If executed well, this move could expand Polymarket's ecosystem and increase retention by creating new DeFi opportunities. pic.twitter.com/qheRiixv0Q ‚Äî OnlyCalls (@0xOnlyCalls) July 22, 2025 Stablecoins have become the main beneficiaries of Polymarket‚Äôs rising activity. All transactions on the platform settle in USDC on the Polygon network. This ensures a steady transaction flow and sustained demand for the token. A deal with Circle or customize its stablecoin? Legislation around stablecoins passed in the US last week makes issuing a stablecoin an attractive business proposition for crypto native firms and more traditional finance players alike. To that end, launching a stablecoin is hard for many companies. For instance, Circle, the company that created USDC, is known to be ending revenue-sharing deals with exchanges, payment companies, and other fintechs. The reason behind this is to stay competitive in a field that is changing so quickly. A Polymarket representative said no decision has yet been made on the stablecoin question. However, of the two options, for Polymarket, issuing its own stablecoin is a much easier lift from a regulatory standpoint. According to a person familiar with the matter, ‚ÄúIn the case of Polymarket, it‚Äôs a closed ecosystem and all they really need to do is to be able to exchange USDC or USDT into whatever their custom stablecoin is. They don‚Äôt have to worry about the last mile on ramp and off ramp. That‚Äôs a very simple thing to build, and easy to secure and control.‚Äù In addition, Polymarket has grown in popularity. According to SimilarWeb, over $8 billion in bets were placed during last year‚Äôs US election cycle, and the site saw nearly 16 million visits in May. Also, Polymarket announced plans to overhaul its reward and oracle-resolution system. The new framework, part of its 2028 Election Holding Rewards program, will offer more accurate pricing and easier migration for users. Meanwhile, Polymarket wants to buy QCEX, a CFTC-licensed exchange and clearinghouse, in a $112 million deal that clears the path for regulated operations in the world‚Äôs largest financial market. It is based in the US. This follows the closure of civil and criminal investigations into its allowing US-based customers to place bets on its platform. Polymarket has handled more than $14 billion in trades since its launch. It had more than $1 billion in monthly volume in May alone, with 20,000 to 30,000 active daily traders. After Trump‚Äôs re-election in November 2024, the platform moved $2.5 billion in a single month, making it one of its busiest times. During that surge, there were a lot of USDC transfers and more action on the bridges to move money around. KEY Difference Wire : the secret tool crypto projects use to get guaranteed media coverage

title: PENDLE Token: Unlocking Strategic Profits with Arca‚Äôs Latest Move
body: BitcoinWorld PENDLE Token: Unlocking Strategic Profits with Arca‚Äôs Latest Move The cryptocurrency world is always buzzing with activity, and recent on-chain data has sparked considerable discussion. A significant transfer involving a substantial amount of PENDLE token has caught the eye of market observers, particularly given its potential link to a prominent digital asset investment firm. This move, which saw millions of dollars worth of PENDLE tokens shifting to a major exchange, underscores the dynamic nature of crypto investments and the strategic maneuvers employed by large players. What Just Happened with the PENDLE Token Transfer? In a development that quickly circulated through crypto communities, an address believed to be associated with Arca, a well-known digital asset investment firm, executed a notable transfer of PENDLE tokens. According to on-chain analytics shared by @EmberCN on X , approximately 2.183 million PENDLE tokens, valued at an impressive $10.44 million, were moved to the Kraken exchange just a few hours ago. This kind of large-scale movement often signals strategic intent, whether it‚Äôs for liquidity provision, portfolio rebalancing, or, as speculated in this case, profit-taking. Let‚Äôs break down the key details of this transaction: Token Transferred: PENDLE token Amount: 2.183 million PENDLE Approximate Value: $10.44 million Recipient Exchange: Kraken Suspected Origin: Arca-linked address Estimated Profit (at current prices): $2.13 million Such transfers are meticulously tracked by analysts because they can offer insights into the strategies of major holders, often referred to as ‚Äòwhales‚Äô in the crypto space. When an entity like Arca, known for its deep research and strategic investments, makes such a move, it naturally draws attention from the broader market. Who is Arca, and Why Does This PENDLE Token Move Matter? Arca is a leading digital asset investment firm that focuses on providing institutional-grade products and services in the cryptocurrency market. They are known for their active management strategies, deep dives into crypto projects, and their ability to identify promising opportunities within the evolving digital asset landscape. Their portfolio often includes innovative DeFi protocols and emerging tokens, making their movements particularly noteworthy. The significance of Arca‚Äôs potential involvement in this PENDLE token transfer lies in several factors: Institutional Confidence: A move by a reputable firm like Arca can be interpreted as a validation of the PENDLE token‚Äôs potential or a strategic decision to capitalize on its performance. Market Impact: Large transfers to exchanges can sometimes precede significant price action, either due to increased selling pressure if the tokens are offloaded, or a strategic re-entry if the firm is preparing for future moves. Transparency in DeFi: While the address is ‚Äòsuspected‚Äô to be linked, the very nature of blockchain allows for the tracking of these large movements, providing a degree of transparency that is unique to the crypto market. Arca‚Äôs investment thesis often revolves around yield-generating assets and innovative financial primitives, which aligns well with PENDLE‚Äôs core functionality. PENDLE is a DeFi protocol that allows users to tokenize and trade future yield, essentially creating a market for future interest rates on various crypto assets. This unique value proposition has made it an attractive asset for sophisticated investors. Decoding the Profit Potential: A Closer Look at the PENDLE Token Gain One of the most compelling aspects of this specific PENDLE token transfer is the estimated profit it represents. If the tokens were indeed acquired at a lower price and are now being moved to an exchange for sale, the estimated profit of $2.13 million is substantial. This figure highlights the significant returns that can be achieved in the volatile yet rewarding cryptocurrency market. How is this profit estimated? Typically, on-chain analysts trace the acquisition cost of the tokens. If an address acquired 2.183 million PENDLE tokens at an average price significantly lower than the current market price of approximately $4.78 (at the time of the transfer), the difference constitutes the unrealized or realized profit. This suggests that Arca or the linked entity had a long-term or well-timed investment in PENDLE, demonstrating successful asset management. This profit realization could serve multiple purposes for Arca: Capital Reallocation: Freeing up capital for new investment opportunities within the crypto space. Fund Management: Distributing returns to investors or rebalancing fund portfolios. Risk Management: Taking profits off the table to reduce exposure to a single asset, especially after a significant price run. The ability to secure such a substantial profit underscores the expertise required to navigate the complexities of decentralized finance and identify high-growth potential assets like the PENDLE token. The Wider Implications: What Does This PENDLE Token Activity Mean for the Market? A transfer of this magnitude, especially one linked to a prominent institutional player, can have ripple effects across the market. While not a definitive signal for immediate price action, it contributes to the overall market sentiment and liquidity dynamics of the PENDLE token. Here are some potential implications: Increased Liquidity on Kraken: Moving PENDLE tokens to Kraken increases the supply available for trading on that exchange, potentially facilitating larger buy or sell orders. Market Sentiment: Depending on how the market interprets the move (profit-taking vs. rebalancing), it can influence investor confidence. Some might see it as a bearish signal if they believe a sell-off is imminent, while others might view it as healthy profit-taking by a smart money entity. On-Chain Analytics Interest: This event will undoubtedly lead more analysts to scrutinize PENDLE‚Äôs on-chain data, looking for further insights into large holder behavior and potential future movements. Attention to PENDLE Protocol: Such high-profile transfers bring increased attention to the PENDLE protocol itself, potentially drawing new investors or developers to explore its unique yield-trading capabilities. It‚Äôs crucial for individual investors to remember that while tracking ‚Äòwhale‚Äô movements can be insightful, these are just one piece of the puzzle. Institutional strategies are complex and often involve hedging, diversification, and long-term outlooks that differ from those of retail investors. Navigating the Crypto Landscape: Actionable Insights from PENDLE Token Movements For investors looking to make sense of these large transfers and improve their own strategies, here are some actionable insights: Stay Informed: Follow reputable on-chain analytics accounts and news sources. Understanding the flow of funds is a vital part of crypto market analysis. Understand the Asset: Before investing, thoroughly research the PENDLE token and its underlying protocol. What problem does it solve? What is its utility? What are its tokenomics? Diversify Your Portfolio: Don‚Äôt put all your eggs in one basket. Even successful institutional investors like Arca diversify their holdings. Practice Risk Management: Set stop-losses, take profits strategically, and only invest what you can afford to lose. The crypto market is inherently volatile. Do Your Own Research (DYOR): While large transfers provide data points, they should not be the sole basis for your investment decisions. Always conduct your own thorough due diligence. The crypto market rewards those who are diligent, patient, and adaptable. Observing the moves of entities like Arca can provide valuable context, but ultimately, a well-informed and disciplined approach is key to long-term success. The transfer of $10.44 million in PENDLE tokens from an Arca-linked address to Kraken is more than just a large transaction; it‚Äôs a window into the strategic thinking of institutional players in the digital asset space. With an estimated profit of $2.13 million, this move highlights the lucrative opportunities within the DeFi sector, particularly for innovative protocols like PENDLE. While the immediate market impact remains to be seen, this event serves as a reminder of the constant flow of capital, the importance of on-chain analytics, and the ever-evolving landscape of cryptocurrency investments. As the market matures, understanding these high-value transfers becomes increasingly vital for both seasoned investors and curious newcomers alike. Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs) What is PENDLE Token? PENDLE is a decentralized finance (DeFi) protocol that allows users to tokenize and trade future yield. It separates yield-bearing assets into principal tokens (PT) and yield tokens (YT), enabling users to lock in future yield, speculate on yield rates, or earn fixed interest. Who is Arca? Arca is a prominent digital asset investment firm that provides institutional-grade products and services for investing in cryptocurrencies. They are known for their research-driven approach and active management of various digital asset funds. Why did an Arca-linked address move PENDLE tokens to Kraken? While the exact reason is not publicly disclosed, such large transfers to exchanges by institutional firms often indicate a strategic move such as profit-taking, rebalancing a portfolio, increasing liquidity for potential future trades, or preparing for capital reallocation into other assets. What is the significance of this $10.44 million PENDLE transfer? The significance lies in the size of the transfer and the potential link to Arca. It highlights substantial realized or unrealized profits, signals institutional activity around the PENDLE token, and contributes to market sentiment and liquidity dynamics, making it a noteworthy event for on-chain analysts and investors. How can I track large crypto movements like this? You can track large crypto movements using on-chain analytics platforms (e.g., Arkham Intelligence, Nansen, Lookonchain) and by following reputable crypto analysts on social media platforms like X (formerly Twitter) who specialize in on-chain data interpretation. Did you find this deep dive into the PENDLE token transfer insightful? Share this article with your friends and fellow crypto enthusiasts on social media to spread awareness about strategic institutional moves in the digital asset space! To learn more about the latest crypto market trends, explore our article on key developments shaping the PENDLE token‚Äôs future price action and institutional adoption.
